IN 1621 THE English scholar Robert Burton wrote of the glut of information reaching him daily . “ Shipwrecks , wrecks of ships, ships lost, ships lost to fire, and ships burned and destroyed . . . a great multitude of ships . . . every day I get more than a dozen or fourteen ships wrecked or burned . . . I read the histories of most of these ships and am glad I have never been a sailor .”

Burton was not alone in thinking that the world was more interesting than it looked. The world was full of wonders; he was not the only one who had noticed them.

column1: Australia 's newest young migrants are overwhelmingly optimistic about the future - but that does n't last long . New Census data released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) on Monday found that in 2014-15, the number of Australian residents between the ages of 17 and 24 who were born in another country has surged to its highest level since the 1996 census . Australians born overseas are up from 6.4 percent in 2001-02 and the highest level since the 1996 census. "They think the future is brighter and we need to do more, they think they're better," said the ABS's chief statistician, Kate Spence.

An Ohio sheriff has asked fairgoers to leave Confederate flags at home after the display of a flag led to a confrontation between two officers and a protestor at a festival in New Albany on Saturday, according to the Columbus Dispatch. The incident occurred outside the New Albany County Fair and it was caught on video:

Officers from the New Albany police department, who are familiar with the flags, confronted a man who was displaying a Confederate flag during the event Saturday afternoon near the fair grounds, officials said. When authorities asked the flag-bearing protester to take it down, he refused.

column1: The researchers at Rice University in the US engineered scaffolds that replicate the physical characteristics of osteochondral tissue - hard cartilage that provides the body with smooth frictionless surfaces and resists wear. They believe this technique could eventually lead to artificial cartilage for use in artificial joints and prosthetic limbs. The scientists created their scaffolds by mixing calcium carbonate granules with calcium phosphate to form a calcium carbonate/calcium phosphate mixture
column2: which then solidifies into a porous
column3: porous ceramic. The researchers used a technique called sol-gel processing that creates a ceramic-like material by mixing calcium
column4: carbon and phosphate together.

column1: DETROIT — Experts say a bright light and what sounded like thunder in the sky above Michigan was a meteor that exploded in midair on Monday, striking downtown Detroit as a meteor shower — and leaving the sky lit up for the first time in decades for millions of sky watchers around the globe. The bright light streaked across the sky over the Michigan capital as a bright flash, lasting about 30 seconds, briefly appeared. "This is nothing less than a miracle," Michigan State University astrophysics professor Jay Pasachoff told the Associated Press. No one was injured. Meteor experts were puzzled.

column1: Why should you set goals before investing ? Investment is a long-term activity where the investor tends to invest in a market where the expected return is high

column3: if the investor wants to make money in an uncertain or high risk situation then it is an investment activity. This is different from a financial activity in the market. There is always a high probability of failure or loss while you are investing. It is an uncertain opportunity where it is not possible for the investor to know for certain the future profit or loss.

column3: chemicals

column1: KABUL , Afghanistan — A suicide car bombing tore through a U.S. convoy during rush hour in the Afghan capital of Kabul, killing at least 17 American service members and three Afghans, officials said Sunday, the most deadly such attack on foreign soldiers in the United States since 2001. It was also the first time that U.S. forces have been targeted in a suicide strike in Afghanistan. The Taliban immediately claimed responsibility for the attack, calling it "a bold and highly significant terrorist action." National academy recommends legalizing tests where there is risk of serious incurable disease . The Leopoldina , Germany & aposl

The Leopoldina , Germany's most prestigious medical school , has issued a policy statement which says that "there are good reasons to legalise clinical trials with serious side effects, especially when the benefit of the intervention would outweigh the potential risks for the participants". The temperature is on the rise and next week the UK will be basking in temperatures as hot as Spain

Last week’s heat wave is going to become the hottest week on record for Britain, and the UK will pass Spain’s record of 38.3C in June for the second time this century. Temperatures on Wednesday will be 38C, and by the weekend, 38.9C. Temperatures on Friday will be 37C, and by Saturday, 38.7C. The temperature is set to rise even more next week as it passes its high point of 39.5C on Saturday and will reach a peak of 39.9C on Sunday.

Tolls on the San Francisco Bay Area 's seven state-owned bridges will go up by $ 1 starting on Jan. 1, 2017, according to an announcement. (Al Seib/KQED)

State officials are expected to approve a $1 increase to the tolls on all the state-owned bridges on the Peninsula, including the Golden Gate, Marin and San Francisco bridges, according to an announcement from Governor Jerry Brown on Monday. The new toll rate will raise the cost to $8.75 per day for one-way and $10.00 for round-trips, a $1 increase, from $8.50 and $ 11.25.

The Board of Supervisors voted Tuesday to sign off on putting a toll increase on the June ballot — not because it was in the county's best interests or because the money will be raised for roads. Supervisor Todd Spitzer explained that the reason for approving the new fee was that he felt it was better to take a vote now rather than hold it up in the courts. He noted the county can always put the new fee on the ballot next November. Spitzer is the chair of the board's Finance and Administration Committee.

column1: Researchers at William & Mary
column2: with collaborators from the University of Connecticut
column3: have discovered a way of measuring a drug in the brain that could help to predict how it might interact with a disease. They used magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) in mice to map changes in blood flow in the brain as a drug was administered. They discovered that an MRI-based biomarker – a marker that could distinguish a drug from other compounds in a test tube or from other drugs in the brain – was associated with increased blood flow into brain regions that are affected in people with multiple sclerosis (MS).

If you want insight into how likely someone is to have ADHD , you could ask them about symptoms of ADHD , but it could get complicated. The symptoms of ADHD usually fall into three general categories:

Cognitive

Emotional

Behavioral

Cognitive ADHD is a disorder characterized by attention deficits that result from a disturbance in how we process, store and use information. In general, it is considered to be a learning disability that impacts attention, learning, memory and problem solving. The symptoms can be subtle, yet can have a substantial impact on day-to-day functioning and academic achievement.

The Pentagon 's new bases abroad . column1: Foreclosures Down in January , but Surge on Way ? The number of U.S. households facing foreclosure in January increased in January , but it was a decline over the last four months and not an increase, a new report from the Mortgage Bankers Association found. In fact, foreclosure activity has fallen over the last six months to its lowest point since December 2008, the MBA reported. "This is the first decline in the foreclosure rate since December 2008 when mortgage rates spiked," said Michael Heaney, senior vice president for research and data analysis for The MBA, in a prepared statement.

This article is more than 3 years old

This article is more than 3 years old

Emergency ambulances were being dispatched from hospitals in England to patients with minor heart attacks more quickly in 2016, according to figures released by the NHS. In the year to September 2017, the ambulance service dispatched a median of 8 minutes 30 seconds between arrival of a patient and the point at which they were given an emergency call-out to a hospital. In the same period the previous year the median distance was 9 minutes 25 seconds.

column1: Chronic constrictive pericarditis ( CP ) is a relatively rare condition in which the pericardium becomes fibrotic and noncompliant
column2: thereby compressing and narrowing the space between the heart and the chest wall. This causes chest pain or discomfort and shortness of breath and can result in reduced cardiac output
column3: as well as cardiac failure. The exact underlying mechanism of CP remains unknown
column4: but most cases have been reported in the context of viral infection. CP is commonly associated with a history of congestive cardiac failure (CCF)
column5: especially in patients with rheumatic heart disease and mitral valve prolapse.

For the first International Women's Polo Cup, the club brought in umpires from Pakistan and made sure that both teams had an equal number of players and umpires.

Nurses and doctors in Irish hospitals have been urged not to call patients “ love ” or “ dear ” on social media amid fears of a rise in cyberbullying in healthcare. Dallas-based artist Ryder Richards spent a month in Chattanooga , creating pieces based on the CIA destruction of hard drives and documents in the wake of the 9/11 attacks. “All the data is gone. The hard drives. It’s pretty scary,” he said on a recent afternoon . “It was pretty devastating.”

In the two weeks following 9/11, Richards collected over 10,000 pieces of art, many of which depicted scenes of devastation, destruction and mourning. He also created a video titled “Shattered Glass” about the attacks. The film was released in early January and went viral on YouTube.

The Cleveland branch of NAACP turns 100 this year and the group continues to fight for civil rights for Northeast Ohioans

This story was produced by The Spectator, an online publication covering British culture, politics and social trends. On May 5, 1919, nine African-American men were arrested for disorderly conduct and jailed in a Cleveland streetcar car. It was the first racial arrest in a Cleveland streetcar. As the men were led into police headquarters after their encounter, they were greeted with applause and cheers from the nearly 200 onlookers. They were later released without charges, and continued their protest march to the Cleveland City Hall.

column1: Winooski City Manager Josh Handverger has been cleared of charges he created a hostile work environment when he wrote e-mails to his supervisors in which he criticized their performance, the state of Vermont has said. Vermont's commission said it found the hostile work environment claims were "unsubstantiated" but it did find Handverger was insubordinate and a "poor manager."

column1: The CERES Experiment is a NASA project that measures Earth 's incoming and outgoing energy . The picture above is the result of an analysis performed by one of the researchers working on the CERES experiment. He is a physicist who has worked on several of NASA's Earth observation projects including Landsat and is now collaborating on the CERES experiment. CERES measures the outgoing energy through the process of infrared radiative cooling of Earth which is a fundamental process in Earth science. The incoming energy is measured by the amount of energy that the Earth absorbs from the cosmic microwave background radiation which makes up the blackbody spectrum of the Universe at our location.

column1: Maricopa County Sheriff Joe Arpaio , via Wikipedia . One of America ’ s most controversial law enforcement officials , Arpaio has gained nationwide notoriety for his racially-charged tactics in enforcing immigration laws , including the controversial " stop and frisk " program . In 2003 he was indicted on criminal charges relating to his enforcement of immigration laws , resulting in a two- year court ordeal . Arpaio was also a target of a lawsuit brought by the ACLU in 2008 over his policies in Arizona . He has since been indicted on federal crimes relating to illegal immigration . A court trial in 2010 saw Arpaio acquitted on all charges .

column1: We already know that 84 % of new buses will be electric by 2030
column2: which should bode well for the market . The question we should ask is : will electric buses make the most of the market opportunity ? Most electric vehicles in Europe will have a range in the order of 500 - 1000km while the range per charge for the petrol cars they replace will be about 200km . This makes them much less attractive as an electric alternative to ICE cars.

Astronomers have found evidence of water ice in the moon's polar regions. For the past few decades, scientists have suspected that water ice exists within the moon, and now we may have some hard scientific evidence. The water is likely to have come from ice that was captured from space when the moon passed through an icy ring in its distant past.

column2: including patient adherence? We searched PubMed for studies (published in English or Spanish) between January 1966
column3: and April 2013. Search terms used were stroke or cerebrovascular or vascular and intervention or strategy. column1: Analysis firm compares attacks in third quarter to previous three months . "I would say the trend is still positive," said Gary Krakow, a security researcher at FireEye, which provides services to government customers, in an email response to questions . Ancient bones and teeth found in Callao Cave in the Philippines have led to the discovery of a previously unknown human species, scientists said Thursday. Human remains were discovered along with stone tools and a pair of molars in the cave in October 2015, leading to a hunt for more than two months to collect more bones and teeth. "This species represents the most significant evolutionary event in the human lineage since our ancestors split from the chimpanzees," the researchers wrote in the study describing the bones as belonging to a previously unknown hominin species.

Last fall at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, a group of about 20 students, researchers and engineers embarked on a weekend project to solve a real-world problem. They focused on energy management for buildings. The team, which included five students in the first year of an M.S. program in computer science, set up a virtual hackathon to build an app that could analyze the energy consumption patterns of a building’s electrical equipment and suggest ways to cut back on energy.

column1: St. Petersburg 's Constitutional Court , where the ruling allowing WTO ratification to take place was passed Monday . column1: The innocuous white trails that criss-cross the sky may not be as harmless as they look . In fact , they may have deadly consequences for birds and people, say a group of conservation scientists. A new study in the journal PLoS ONE shows the white trails to be "a powerful driver of global bird species diversity" and may also mean an increase in the spread of deadly avian diseases. The research, funded by the European Research Council and the Leverhulme Trust, focused on two species, the common whitethroat and the red knot.

The dead included three teenagers and 15 women. The Palestinian death toll was put at over 100 by the United Nations but the Palestinians say that the true figure is closer to 200. Israel says there are many more civilians being killed in Israeli airstrikes on Gaza and in Israeli shelling of its territory. The Israeli government is not allowing journalists to enter the area where the Palestinian casualties took place.

column1: Nigeria 's President Muhammadu Buhari has missed his third cabinet meeting in a row amid ongoing questions about the state of his health and whether his office is being run from behind the scenes. However, a source close to the presidential palace said the president would not meet with his ministers until Wednesday, after which they would convene a cabinet meeting on Friday.

PHOENIX ( AP ) - The attorney general says a luxury hotel group is improperly receiving millions of dollars in government money for remodeling the complex that houses the Arizona Department of Transportation's maintenance facilities in Chandler. Attorney General Tom Horne told the state Transportation Department last week that the Phoenix-based Gavilan Inn Group is receiving over $1 million in grant money from the federal and state governments and should repay taxpayers. Horne said he's also reviewing the state's agreement with the company for the $5 million state contract for work to be completed at the three-building site.

Following are excerpts from the inaugural address yesterday by the new President of Indonesia , B. J. Habibie , and the formal opening ceremony of his country's new Parliament. "For many decades, Indonesia has struggled with poverty, corruption and a shortage of jobs and a growing dependence on oil revenues," said Habibie. "Today, Indonesia is embarking on a new and hopeful chapter of development. It is an ambitious agenda for change, but it rests on fundamental principles of justice, social justice, peace and democracy that have inspired great leaders in the past."

Brexit no-deal planning meant a council destroyed 17,000 of Britain 's rarest orchids in one day - and it will cost taxpayers around £6 million. The council in Suffolk - where there has been no vote for more than 200 years - decided it would not deal with the emergency because it believes it is illegal to destroy them. Instead, it decided to move them to another location to allow them a "safe" home until new ones are built in the right location. But this has meant the destruction of 17,000 of Britain's rare orchids - the world's smallest orchid, and one of only around 3,000 known to exist.

RICHMOND, Va. — At least a dozen Confederate monuments have been removed by a city commission in recent years, but this time, officials decided to make history by removing the statue of Dolly Parton, an advocate for civil rights. But not all the controversy was about race. The commission voted unanimously to remove the statue despite concerns over its historical value. One member said the city had no choice because of the state’s statute of limitations on statues removed from public property more than 20 years before.

column1: The White House 's new tools for agile-friendly acquisition are a first step , but critics still contend that federal acquisition programs have become too bureaucratic, slow , and cumbersome. But the shift has yet to translate into a dramatic reduction in the federal government's need for acquisition contracts, which are still crucial to the military, the Department of Justice, and the Pentagon.

column1: The Dongba symbols are an ancient system of pictographic glyphs created by the founder of the Bön religious tradition of Japan, Nichiren Daishonin. The original symbol is based on the kanji character for "wish" or "hope," and therefore it is commonly referred to in English as the wish character. Today, the symbol also incorporates the ideogram for the first two kanji characters of the Chinese alphabet: 琵. The original wish character consisted of the two characters 琵 and 勿, or 琵 (靈, 睢) and 勿 (着, 拆).

Dutch clover is a popular replacement for grass . White Dutch clover ( Trifolium repens ) grows as an evergreen perennial
column2: forming clumps up to 3 feet in diameter. It can grow in a range of soils and is considered to be a hardy perennial. It is a perennial herb with a basal rosette of leaves and a terminal flower head with a cluster of five to twelve yellow ray florets (called a tassel). It has no stem or taproot. It spreads by means of runners that are 1 to 2 inches in length.

Dr. Arnold Klein , the late Michael Jackson ’ s close friend and former dermatologist , passed away on Thursday. He was 88. He was born Arnold Klein in Chicago on June 2, 1933, a son of German Jewish immigrants. He grew up in a family of eight children – five girls and three boys – in Chicago’s Rogers Park neighborhood. When he was six, he and his family moved to Los Angeles, a place he called “the happiest home I’d ever known.”

After serving in the US Army, Klein received his degree in dentistry from California University of Pennsylvania in 1956.

A boom in oil production has made a mockery of our predictions . Good news for capitalists - but a curse on workers

Oil is pouring from oil fields in Saudi Arabia and elsewhere. But it isn't just Saudi Arabia that produces it - it's not just Saudi Arabia. It is an all-pervasive curse on workers across the world. Oil is an indispensable ingredient of the capitalist mode of production but it isn't a necessary one. It doesn't bring anything new to humanity. What it does bring to workers is a great deal of wealth and power.

The health of your mouth can be an early warning system for the health of the rest of your body. While some of us have more awareness of our mouth health than of our general health (a mouth full of bacteria tells you more than a blood-test about your general health), we all should be on the lookout for unhealthy mouth conditions that can be avoided or managed with healthy eating habits. Why You Should Care About Mouth Health

There are many factors that can influence your overall health, including diet, exercise and mental health.

Pyro does not work with any codecs > and can only be played via an external device such as an amplifier or an MP3 player. Pyro is a great project, but I do not recommend trying to use it to encode mp3 files. The encoding quality will suffer because the codecs do not do an adequate job of encoding an 8-bit, lossy sample-based signal like a wav file. There are no encoders that will support Pyro.

The world must act to contain the risk of another devastating housing crash , the International Monetary Fund warned on Monday, a day after the United States hit a record high unemployment level. “The risk of a major global recession,” wrote IMF chief Christine Lagarde in a blog post, “has increased significantly in the recent past and it is likely to continue to grow” in the near future.”

The IMF chief urged governments to consider “new, more innovative measures” to avoid another housing bubble that will eventually burst, as the world’s leading economies struggle to find enough workers to replace a shrinking population.

column1: Scientists are very interested in bacteria for a number of reasons . U.S.|Did the Trump Administration Separate Immigrant Children From Parents and Lose Them ? President Trump over the weekend falsely blamed an Obama-era rule for separating children from their parents when he signed an executive order that ended the practice. Trump's claim is at odds with a U.S. government analysis released late last year which found that the separations have actually dropped since the executive order. The analysis is the first to directly measure the policy change since the Trump order. The data suggests that it is the Trump administration's new policies that have caused the separations to spike.

Historian Barbara Taylor and psychoanalyst Adam Phillips do n't believe that nice people finish last . In their new book, The Moral Animal: What Evolution Has To Teach Us about Humans, they argue that "good" is a misleading term for what makes us moral. It's a much deeper phenomenon that we're often too focused on. The moral animal isn't a label, but a description of a person's or organization's actions in the face of a social challenge. So if you want to make people a little more moral you should try changing the way they see themselves and the people they're around.

column1: Wilcox County , Georgia ( CNN ) - It 's a springtime tradition in this stretch of the magnolia midlands of Georgia . In some parts of East Georgia it is a tradition for schoolchildren to line up in front of the courthouse before the court opens for business. They walk slowly, in silence, one by one. And as they do, they look up to see their parents and grandparents standing in line with them. "Oh, look, Mom, it's the first one in," they chant. In the same town, a little later, a similar scene plays out.

Bob Cannard shovels compost which orignally came from San Francisco food scraps at Green String Farms outside Petaluma , Calif.

Food scraps

The idea of the compost pile began with an idea to put food scraps into the ground to make a living soil where all life can survive. That’s how compost piles work, where organic waste decomposes into humus which is rich in organic nutrients, minerals and micro-organisms. But it takes time for them to do their job. For most food scraps to go into compost, they must come from organic material which has not been sprayed, doused, treated with pesticides or genetically altered.

column1: Dublin : Lawmakers overwhelmingly voted on Friday to back Ireland 's first bill on abortion , legalising the practice in cases where a woman's life is at risk. column2: an art exhibition and the £1.8 million purchase of a site adjacent to the hall that will provide a community garden and a new entrance to Settle Hospital. Now it has been revealed the money is not for just the three projects. The council will spend £2.8 million of it on infrastructure projects that will be funded from the rest of the money.

column1: A communications professor at Texas A & M University wanted to find out about the effects of changes to the way that science was done when he went to college. In particular
column2: he wondered what the effects of changes to the quality of science instruction would be. A group of his colleagues decided to find out what science was
column3: and how it is done. So they created an experimental assignment involving a group of students in science class. They assigned half of them to complete a study about evolution
column4: while the other half to do something completely different: they were to create and write a science paper.

column1: Ken Block makes amazing gymkhana videos . But NSW Police did n't want Ken Block to make this particular gymkhana video - they wanted it for "proper investigation". What did they think they were up to? As soon as this video appeared on YouTube , police had the video removed from the site. Now we have the story of what happened next - and who knew what the police were up to. It all started when Ken Block's brother asked a friend from the police, who in turn approached a senior officer from a major crime squad.
The 27th annual Southwest Iowa Hot Air Balloon Days is underway this weekend in Creston . Balloon committee spokesman Bill Gannon said there is a strong field of contestants this year
column2: but they've had to turn down several pilots. The balloon field is about 20 miles northwest of Creston. There is also an archery contest on Sunday. There are about 80 balloons and about a dozen hot air balloon pilots flying in the air. Gannon said he hasn't heard how many balloon pilots are interested in flying this weekend
column3: but they are interested.

column1: Syria : Why is Assad Advancing ? In the Presidential elections held at the beginning of June
column2: Assad was declared the winner with 76.2% of the vote . This was a record in Syria. However
column3: a few days before that
column4: the Syrian army had made advances in several cities including Homs and Sweida . The army also advanced into the western countryside of the same two provinces. In addition
column5: the army had advanced into southern Syria and had seized several towns in this part of the country. These are the latest advances by the army in southern Syria that has not been achieved for several months.

column1: THE Australian men 's water polo team have come agonisingly close to upsetting three-time defending champions Hungary in their classification final at the World League Championships
column2: but have fallen short of an unprecedented fourth-place finish and a medal at the competition. After leading 3-0 in the final round of the tournament
column3: the Australians lost 2-1 to Germany in the semi-final before falling 2-1 to Germany in their final group stage match
column4: meaning they will now play the winner of that match to determine fifth. It is Australia's worst finish at the World League Championships since losing the gold-medal play-offs for the 2002 and 2006 world championship squads.

column1: This quaint home is located at the end of a cul-de-sac which is situated on the highest point in Fairfield Park

column4: where the children are free to play or relax. Fully fitted kitchen with all appliances included. There is also a utility area which can be utilised for additional storage or use for the guests. The bedroom has a king sized bed and a large wardrobe which can be opened up for storage.

column1: Randy Pausch died last Friday . He was the Carnegie Mellon Professor who ’ s “ Last Lecture ” became the basis for the best novel of the last decade . He died a month after his 69th birthday
column2: the end of what was widely seen as the greatest lecture ever delivered by a professor . I had planned to read the entire lecture on the day it happened
column3: but there was a lot of unfinished business . It would have been my last chance to have a chance to see him interact with the class or hear him tell a joke .

column1: An American Civil Liberties Union lawyer asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco today to block a California law legalizing same-sex marriage because it violates the Constitution by denying equal protection and equal rights to gays and lesbians in the military. Lawyers on the case
column2: which challenges the constitutionality of the Military Readiness Act (MRA)
column3: were arguing for a preliminary injunction against California’s Proposition 8 last week when they learned they had lost on a motion to dismiss. The two-year-old case will now move to the merits
column4: where it is likely to go to the Supreme Court.

column1: VIDEO : On March 30
column3: Atlanta drivers on I-85 north found themselves in a stunning situation when the left lane suddenly became part of the right lane of traffic without any warning. As the left lane is the leftmost lane
column4: the driver in the right lane took the left lane into the traffic without any warning. The video shows that the right lane began to merge with traffic after the vehicle came over the line. The left lane continued to merge as the vehicle came into the lane. The vehicle then slowed to a crawl as the vehicle merged into the right lane of traffic.

column1: Teams of programmers and engineers at Google have created a custom Android app
column2: different versions of which have been published to Google Play. The app is designed to allow Android users to share photos to their personal Google account without the need to switch their accounts. We recently took an in-depth look at how photos are shared with Google Drive on Android and how to use Google's photo upload feature to upload photos to Google Drive on the fly. Today we'll look at the Google Play app
column3: which lets users share their photos directly from the Google+ photo app to their Google Drive account without ever leaving their homescreen.

column1: The new head of the national children ’ s hospital board has said it would be “ bad business ” for a private company to take over the organisation. A spokesman for NHS Providers says the move would mean a “ significant” change in approach for patients. It comes after reports that two hospital trust chiefs are set for the post of leader of the board at a time when the health service is struggling with the biggest spending cuts in its history. It is expected to be one of the most significant changes in the role of the head of children’s hospitals for a decade.

column1: About 300 villagers from Kandal province locked in land disputes with private companies delivered petitions to embassies in Phnom Penh
column2: calling for compensation. When I went to visit
column3: I was not sure if I wanted to go or what to expect. But now
column4: in the weeks since I arrived here
column5: I can see that the situation in Cambodia was much worse than I could have imagined. A few weeks ago
column6: after a series of demonstrations in front of government offices calling for compensation
column7: hundreds of Cambodian villagers came to the embassies in Phnom Penh to hand over their letters and petitions to show they had received them.
